alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 9:14PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL AND WEST CENTRAL QUAY COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM MDT... At 914 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northeast of Montoya, or 15 miles northwest of Tucumcari, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tucumcari. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 316 and 333. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 85 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Quay County
